author: Paradoxymoron
title: Mini 8075
review:
This is a mini version of 8075 Neptune Carrier.It has two new pieces- 2 1X3 tiles in red. There are also 2 1X1 red bricks with studs on only one side, I'm not sure if thes  are new or not. Now, for the pros and cons.

Pros:
Looks awesome
Resembles 8075 quite well
new pieces
2X2 curve things in trans neon green
Fairly sturdy
just overall coolness

Cons:
aside from the fact that mine came with a broken piece, none.

Another quick thing that I wasn't sure whether to put in the pros or cons: It's actually bigger than I thought it would be.

I would suggest getting this set if you aren't in the US or you don't get BrickMaster. It's worth it.

Eerex Sweeher

author: Stayontargetprod
title: One of the better brickmasters
review:
I have to say. This set was fun to build. It had 2 new pieces and 4 that were new to me. Lots of rare red and cool pieces.

Pros
2 new pieces
propeller thing
trans green pieces
good extras
fun build

Cons
Wing light things fall off a lot
When you try to take off one piece. The whole thing 'explodes.'
Only a propeller on one side

Good set. I'd give it a nine but of a 4 or 5, it gets a 4. It isn't a very high 9.
Go to Stayontargetprodalt's youtube channel to find a video review of it.

author: Danblom
title: BrickMasters Ahoy!
review: Into the depths you can go!  Great little set, though there is only a propeller on one side.  Using incredible SNOT (Studs Not Only on Top) tech., I would rate 4/5.  It also comes with the new earling brick which is a 1x1 brick with a stud on the side.  Great set!

author: Squidtron
title: If you need small amounts of neptune carried then I'm hired.
review:
Actually, I have no idea why the big version of this set is called Neptune Carrier, because there is no substance called neptune. Anyway enough of that , this set is small and interesting it has some new and cool parts but it could have used a monster of some kind.

Now for the Cool/Not Cool things about this set.
Cool Parts(+1)
Looks Nice(+2)
Very Swooshable*(+2)
Needs a Monster(-1)

AND THE GRAND TOTAL IS... 4/5 nice

You should buy this set but you can't because its a Brickmaster Exclusive.

author: Zilleonti
title: The first set I got in the mail.
review:
As the title says it was the first Lego Set I've gotten in the mail. I actually enjoyed putting this one together (aside from dropping the transparent round pieces on the floor, lol). I was expecting something smaller so I was surprised on the size of it when it was complete. There are a few pieces that are new to me.

Pros:
I love the Transparent "Neon" Green curved 2x2 pieces.
Rotating Propellar
Quite hefty for being only 63 Pieces.

Cons:
Seems incomplete with only one Propellar
Could of came with 1 Minifigure.

author: NickBrick
title: the only Atlantis set from brickmaster
review:
The set itself is kinda fat in the front.But the best part about the set is that if you have the monster crab clash set you can recreate that seen in the Atlantis movie thing.

                                                       Pros.

  •                                                         red
  •                                                       trans-neon green pices
  •                                                     2 classic red 8 stud brick

                                                                 Cons.

  •                                                         fat in the front
  •                                                          small

author: luckygingle123
title: first atlantis set
review: I'M in brick master club. This is my 2nd brick master set. And my 1st atlantis set. Although,   I only have 2 atlantis sets, manta warrior and neptune micro sub, I like it anyway. IF you're not in the brick master club, thats really :-(. Hope you join :-)!

author: Drumlum
title: Hunt for Red Neptune
review: For Atlantis collectors, this set is a must. I got received this set from a friend when it came out and I have liked it alot. Accuracy-wise, it could use a little help. Some aspects of the  minifigure sized Neptune Sub don't match up with aspects of the Neptune Microsub. Playability level is great. Good for slow decompression swooshing. I really like the size of it for the amount of pieces in it (63); it's a good palm sized model with no extra mini-crafts. if you have a chance to get your hands on it,  go for it!
